Posts.Content: sherry123 wrote: I have been a breast cancer survivor for seven years, but recently have developed swelling in my right hand. I am wondering if this is the beginning of lymphedema. It started after I started a strenuous lifting job.It is in my ndex between fingers. I'm really concerned. It's painful and I can't see a doctor for 3 weeks.Any suggestions? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: lymphedema sherry123 kira

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2009 09:05PM sherry123 wrote: Hi everyone. Thank you all so much for the information.  You are all so warm and kind. I will probably end up going to the emergency room because the soonest appointment I could get with a specialist was for the 21st of March. My daughter keeps urging me to go as well. I will keep you all posted!  Thanks again and God bless, Sherry
Posts.Title: lymphedema sherry123 kira

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2009 08:51PM sherry123 wrote: Hi Kira, They told me to go to the emergency room. I went and I waited 3.5 hours before leaving  . I then went to a health care clinic that was opened until 8pm. They took an x-ray of my back! He was more concerned thatI had pulled a muscle. I asked him if he thought it was lymphedema in my hand and he said he wasn't sure ,but didn't think so because it's usually on the palm rather than on the back of the hand which I thought was quite odd. To make it worse, I asked him if he was going to do anything just in case it was and he asked what I would like! I asked him if I should be on an antibiotic and he asked what I would like to take and he said " Ok I can give you that. Do you want anything else?" What a pip!I I would go to my own oncologist, but I moved 3.5 hours away and I'm in process of finding a new one,preferably one with a bit more sense than this guy. I'm on the zithromax and hoping that it brings the swelling down a bit. I guess I'll have to travel! Thanks for asking. How about you?
Posts.Title: lymphedema sherry123 kira
